GE.evidence:
Nuctech Company Ltd provides security equipment in scope of cooperation with Georgian Government.                                
https://civicidea.ge/en/civic-ideas-6th-china-watch-report-nuctech-company-ltd-in-georgia/new/
GE.answerer: Answered by Valeri Chechelashvili, and has been reviewed by Ani Kintsurashvili

LV.answerer: Answered by Una Aleksandra Berzina-Cerenkova, and has been reviewed by Ani Kintsurashvili

AM.note: The Export-Import Bank of China (China Exim Bank) will provide a loan to Armenia to modernize its customs control service. The respective loan agreement draft was approved at Thursday’s Armenian Cabinet meeting. First Deputy Minister of Finance Pavel Safaryan informed that Armenia will be getting a 155.5-million-yuan (approx. $25,100) loan to purchase the necessary equipment, and primarily from China. The loan will be provided on concessional terms, with a 2 percent annual interest rate and 0.25 percent for services. The equipment supply contract will be signed with Nuctech Company of China, and include portable x-ray scanners that detect explosive devices, weapons, medication, and several other high-level contraband items. https://news.am/eng/news/257792.html
AM.answerer: Answered by Artak Kyurumyan, and has been reviewed by Ani Kintsurashvili

AZ.note:
https://report.az/xarici-siyaset/cinin-dovlet-tehlukesizlik-nazirliyi-azerbaycan-dtx-ve-xarici-kesfiyyat-xidmeti-ile-six-emekdasliq-e/
A memorandum on cooperation between the State Security Service of the Republic of Azerbaijan and the Ministry of State Security of the People's Republic of China and a communique between the Foreign Intelligence Service of Azerbaijan and the Ministry of State Security of China were signed.

EG.note:
“Chinese PSCs (Private Security Companies), however, are already extending feelers in the continent to establish profitable business partnerships, especially in Djibouti, Egypt, Ethiopia, South Africa, and Tanzania.” https://africa.isp.msu.edu/files/6816/3616/1649/PB_42_Arduino_Chinese_Private_Security_Companies.pdf 
“The Egyptian Minister of Electricity and Renewable Energy, Dr. Mohamed Shaker, discussed with Michael Lee, the regional head of the corporate sector for the Chinese company Huawei, ways to gradually shift to the smart grid system... Michael Lee praised the rapid and remarkable development in the projects implemented by the Ministry of Electricity and Renewable Energy and the building of a strong infrastructure and smart network that supports the digital transformation adopted by the Egyptian government.” https://bawabaa.org/news/sustain/514158/         https://securitymea.com/2022/03/30/huawei-proposes-cyber-security-practices-at-csis-egypt-2022/
Huawei showcased its latest E2E cyber security assurance system, and discussed the strategies in the field of cyber security to secure the digital transformation strategy in Egypt, at CSIS Egypt 2022, held in Cairo, Egypt.
https://globalbar.se/2022/08/africa-bright-business-for-chinese-security-firms/
Prepared or not, Chinese companies are extending feelers in African countries to establish security business partnerships. This has been seen in Mali, Djibouti, Egypt, Ethiopia, South Africa and Tanzania.
EG.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Aksana Akhmedova

LB.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by Aksana Akhmedova

BY.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Ani Kintsurashvili

MX.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
MX.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

PA.evidence: Yes, including Hillstone Networks, Huawei, Zhong Bao Hua An Security Company, among others.  Therefore, this indicator deserves a "More than a few" and an "Significant" rating.
PA.answerer: Answered by Alonso Illueca, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

CR.evidence: Although this article (See link 1) highlights the presence of a Chinese company in Costa Rica, there is no evidence to indicate this. The private security sector in Costa Rica has been out of control for several years and many companies operate informally. Therefore the Indicator cannot apply to this Index country.
CR.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

PE.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
PE.note: There is no evidence that Chinese security companies contract with the Peruvian state. However, an Infobae portal reports that China Security Technology Group has a memorandum of cooperation with Grand Tai Peru, a company that provides security in the mining sector.
PE.answerer: Answered by Jack Lo Lau and Jorge Jesús Chávez Ortíz, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

VE.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
VE.note: According to recent research by Leland Lazarus (Florida International University) and Robert Evan Ellis, a company called Tie Shen Bao Biao is working in Venezuela. Unfortunately, it cannot be confirmed whether this company was contracted by the national government or by the sub-national governments of Venezuela.
VE.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

CL.evidence: One of Chile’s most important municipalities (Santiago) received security equipment as a donation from Lishui municipality in China. A second example is the implication of a security agreement with municipalidad de Temuco. Since there are not many more examples, this indicator deserves a "Few" rating. Nevertheless, both these and othe municipalities that have signed agreements with either China or Chinese companies are relevant in both population and strategic importance, and therefore this indicator deserves a "significant" rating.
CL.answerer: Answered by Sascha Hannig Núñez, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

DZ.evidence: As China’s engagement with African countries has grown over the past several years, Beijing is turning to security contractors to protect its Belt and Road Initiative (BRI) projects, citizens, and diplomats. The China Security and Technology Group’s African operations are coordinated from Algeria, Angola, Mozambique, and Kenya, according to its website.  Report 2: In Algeria, for example, where this activity is strictly reserved for nationals, Chinese security companies operate by being integrated with their clients or within the framework of consulting and logistics offices.
DZ.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Filip Noubel

AF.evidence: China has provided non-lethal security equipment (see Nuctech at Kabul airport), as well as mountain forces in Badakhshan. There are also reports that over the years, China has given military aid to the Taliban, though it is unclear how substantial this aid has been. In 2011, the UK and US formally complained to China about the increasing number of Taliban found with new Chinese military hardware.
AF.answerer: Answered by Rahimullah Kakar, and has been reviewed by Niva Yau

TM.answerer: Answered by Temur Umarov, and has been reviewed by Niva Yau

NG.evidence: There is evidence to suggest that DeWe Security Service Group is active in Nigeria. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a “Few” rating. DeWe Security Service Group one of the most well-known overseas Chinese firms. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an “Significant” rating.
NG.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

ZA.evidence: Frontier Services Group operates in South Africa, with Frontier Logistics South Africa as an arm. Given its South African counterpart, it deserves a significant rating. Zhongjun Junhong Group offers an escort service in South Africa's Durban harbour. Given the small overall presence, the rating deserves a "Few"rating.
ZA.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

TW.evidence: According to the items of business that allow Chinese citizens to invest in on the website of Investment Commission, Ministry of Economic Affairs, security service is not one of them.

BR.evidence: Over the past few years, a number of subnational governments have hosted representatives from PRC companies or travel abroad to visit their headquarters in order to build a partnership agenda covering public safety issues. Some projects are still in the pilot phase, while others have already begun to be implemented. In 2018, the city of Campinas strengthened its partnership with Huawei to implement security solutions by establishing another stage of the Safe Cities pilot project. In 2023, the Presidente Vargas stadium, managed by the city of Fortaleza, received a facial recognition system for event security, involving software, an operating room and a TV circuit. The technology is from Hikvision.
BR.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

PH.evidence: There are no reports of China security services being contracted in the Philippines.
PH.note: Persons who shall be employed as security guard or private detective in the Philippines must be a Filipino citizen, except foreigners who have been hired before the effectivity of Republic Act No. 5487, or the Private Security Agency Law, in 1969. The law was strengthened by Republic Act No. 11917, or the Private Security Services Industry Act, which lapsed into law in 2022. Security agencies are regulated by the Supervisory Office for Security and Investigation Agencies under the Philippine National Police - Civil Security Group.
PH.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 3 anonymous experts.

TH.evidence: There is no indicator of the said phenomenon.

MM.evidence: Myanmar has approximately 140 private security companies, with about 16 being partially or fully foreign-owned, originating from both Western and Asian countries. Notably, only a minority of these companies are Chinese-owned, with 24 out of 49 firms from the combined total in Cambodia and Myanmar having Chinese ownership.
MM.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.
